VLIB Function Reference

2D Image convolution for N Input and M Output channels

Introduction

The convolution functions are essential ingredients to CNN application but are not limited to this application alone.

Filter sizes of 5x5 is supported.

Specification

Function

Performs K x K convolution of N 16-bit input channels with N x M 16-bit weights producing M 32-bit output channels.

Each W x H 16-bit inputs of an input channel are convolved with corresponding K x K 16-bit weights and accumulated N times to produce one (W - K) + 1 x (H - K) + 1 32-bit output. This process is repeated for M output channels.

Variants

This functionality is available in 2 variants:
  • skip1 : Convolution outputs for all points.
  • skip2 : Convolution outputs are skipped in alternate horizontal and vertical pixels.

APIS

5x5 convolution:
  • VLIB_conv_i16s_c16s_o32s_5x5_skip1_tile
  • VLIB_conv_i16s_c16s_o32s_5x5_skip2_tile
